City Council District 4
-----------------------

![](https://ci.lubbock.tx.us/storage/images/YY0BzBKxOnRJpnAWbI36VIerCI3UEWznHvN7y8wz.jpg)

Brayden Rose, District 4
------------------------

Brayden Rose was elected to represent District 4 on the Lubbock City Council in May 2024.

Brayden was born and raised in Lubbock, where he attended Frenship ISD and graduated from the Rawls College of Business at Texas Tech University. He currently helps operate his family business at McGavock Auto Group.

Brayden’s
mission as Councilmember is to foster positive business growth and development, ensure public safety remains the top priority, promote fiscal responsibility, and protect Lubbock’s conservative principles. Brayden aims to promote collaboration, transparency, and effective representation within the Lubbock City Council.

Brayden believes that a community cannot thrive if it is not safe and secure. He will work to ensure that the City is responsive to new infrastructure needs created by rapid growth, and that tax dollars are spent responsibly on necessary projects involving the growth across Lubbock and District 4.
